Project Name: Zionist Posters Promoting Israel to Diaspora Jews, 1940-1979
Subject: Israel and the diaspora $v Posters|~|Zionism $y 20th century $v Posters
Description.note: Collection consists of posters issued chiefly by the Jewish National Fund to encourage diaspora Jews to travel to Israel and to support Israel financially and politically. The posters cover topics such as agriculture, land reclamation and settlement, holidays and celebrations, and campaigns. They are in full color with texts in Hebrew, English, French, and Spanish.
Title: Collection of Zionist Posters Promoting Israel to Diaspora Jews, 1940-1979

Project Name: Zionist Posters Promoting Israel to Diaspora Jews, 1940-1979
Subject: Land settlement $z Israel|~|Dairy farming $z Israel|~|Agriculture $z Israel
Description.note: Poster depicts a fenced-in cowshed, in front of which a girl feeds a calf from a bucket and a boy pets a cow. The girl is wearing a yellow headscarf, a blue blouse, a red, skirt, blue socks, and black shoes. The boy is wearing a kova tembel, a blue collared shirt, mustard pants, and green boots. The boy is holding a milk jug. Beside the cowshed is a pitchfork standing in a tuft of grass. In the background, a male stands on a donkey cart loaded with milk jugs on a path beside another fenced-in cowshed where 3 cows stand. The path continues to a hill with buildings and a water tower.
Description.caption: Issued by the Jewish National Fund. Publié par le Keren Kayemeth LeIsrael. Publicación del Keren Kayemet LeIsrael. Jerusalem. תוצאת הקק הקימת. לישראל ירושלים
AltTitle.descriptive: En el establo|~|In the cowshed|~|Dans l'étable
Title: ברפת = In the cowshed = Dans l'étable = En el establo

Project Name: Zionist Posters Promoting Israel to Diaspora Jews, 1940-1979
Subject: Land settlement $z Israel|~|Agriculture $z Israel|~|Horse farms $z Israel
Description.note: A boy with brown hair, a blue kova tembel hat, white tank top, blue shorts, and sandals leads a brown horse by its bridle. Another horse is in the background in a yellow barn. A third horse is in the background, pulling a hay wagon with a man sitting on top of the hay, driving the wagon. Poster colors are primarily brown, green, yellow, orange, and blue.
Description.caption: K.K.L. Israel. הוצאת הקרך הקימת לישראל, ירושלים.
Title: הארוה = The stable = El establo = L'ecurie

The trees are in various shapes and shades of green.

Poster is primarily in blue, green, brown, and light grey.

Project Name: Zionist Posters Promoting Israel to Diaspora Jews, 1940-1979
Subject: Land settlement $z Israel|~|Reclamation of land $z Israel
Name.creator: Barak, Nachsholi, $d 1922-
Description.note: Artist's signature: ב. נחשולי|~|Two men wearing shades of blue are using tools to move a large rock. One wears a grey cap, the other wears a blue kova tembel hat. Another man wearing a blue kova tembel hat in the background loads rocks into a wheelbarrow. An fourth man wearing a grey cap moves rocks out of the way with a red bulldozer. In the distance are several white and red buildings and trees, with a water tower. Poster is primarily blue, brown, grey, and red.
Description.caption: Issued by the Jewish National Fund, Jerusalem. Publie par le Keren Kayemeth LeIsrael, Jerusalem. Publicacion del Keren Kayemeth LeIsrael, Jerusalen. הוצאת הקרך הקימת לישראל, ירושלים.

Project Name: Zionist Posters Promoting Israel to Diaspora Jews, 1940-1979
Subject: Water towers $z Israel|~|Land settlement $z Israel|~|Agriculture $z Israel
Name.creator: Berger, Zvi
Description.note: Poster depicts a white water tower surrounded by buildings and agricultural fields. The water tower is topped with a seven-branched menorah. Pipes from the water tower connect to buildings and irrigation. In the fields, a female is watering tomatoes with a watering can, a male wearing a kova tembel is watering root vegetables with a hose, and sprinklers water grass. Visible through the window of one house, a person is using water at a sink. In the background are more fields supplied by irrigation sprinklers, and trees and buildings on hills.
Description.caption: Issued by the Jewish National Fund. Publié par le Kayemeth LeIsrael. Publicación del Keren Kayemet LeIsrael. Jerusalem. תוצאת הקק הקימת לישראל. ירושלים.|~|צ. ברגר 62
Title: The water tower = Château d'eau = Torre de agua = מגדל המים

An explosion is in the far background. Poster is primarily in shades of brown, yellow, and green.
Description.caption: Issued by the Jewish National Fund, Jerusalem. Publie par le Keren Kayemeth LeIsrael, Jerusalem. Publicacion del Keren Kayemet LeIsrael, Jerusalen. הוצאת הקרך הקימת לישראל, ירושלים.

Description.note: Poster is drawn to look like it is in two layers with one layer peeling off. The top "layer" portrays a desert landscape, with scrubby bushes and dry, arid land. The bottom "layer" has stylized cultivated field plots, houses, a water tower, and trees on green hills. Poster is primarily in greens and browns.|~|Artist signature: דוד ז״ק
Description.caption: Issued by the Jewish National Fund, Jerusalem. Publie par le Keren Kayemeth LeIsrael, Jerusalem. Publicacion del Keren Kayemet LeIsrael, Jerusalen. הוצאת הקרך הקימת לישראל, ירושלים.

Project Name: Zionist Posters Promoting Israel to Diaspora Jews, 1940-1979
Subject: Land settlement $z Israel|~|Reclamation of land $z Israel|~|Gardening $z Israel
Name.creator: Schloss, Ruth, $d 1922-
Description.note: Four children working in a garden. Sunflowers are growing in the back corner, and next to them are a wheelbarrow, rake, and spade. A girl with pigtails in a white and blue-dotted top and red skirt rakes the ground in the foreground. A boy in a red shirt, blue shorts, and yellow kova tembel hat waters a seedling with a watering can. Another boy, blond, wearing a blue kova tembel hat and shirt, and yellow shorts kneels on the ground, tending a seedling. An androgynous child wearing a white shirt and blue pants carries a bouquet of flowers. Poster is primarily brown, white, red, and blue.|~|Artist signature: ר. שלוס
Description.caption: Issued by the Jewish National Fund, Jerusalem. Publie par le Keren Kayemeth LeIsrael, Jerusalem. Publicacion del Keren Kayemet LeIsrael, Jerusalen. הוצאת הקרך הקימת לישראל, ירושלים.

Subject: Reclamation of land $z Israel|~|Tree planting $z Israel|~|Afforestation $z Israel

Description.note: A boy wearing a blue shirt and shorts kneels planting a stalk. He wears a blue kova tembel hat. A girl stands next to him in a blue dress and blue bow, holding a seedling in a pot. In the background, red and orange hills are covered with tall green plants, probably stylized trees, and several houses are situated at the hills' base. The background is teal.|~|English title from the Palestine Poster Project website.|~|Artist's name printed on poster: דוד ז״ק
Title: עלה וצמח שתילי הרך שי מאת הקרן הקימת לישראל

Project Name: Zionist Posters Promoting Israel to Diaspora Jews, 1940-1979
Subject: Land settlement $z Israel|~|Agriculture $z Israel
Name.creator: Franḳfurṭer, Brigiṭah
Description.note: Poster depicts a male farmer tilling a field with a tractor while 1 child faces him and waves at him and another child crouches to pick a flower. The farmer is wearing an orange kova tembel, orange collared shirt, and brown pants. The waving child is carrying a doll and wearing a white long-sleeved shirt with orange and green patterns on the hems, plaid orange, green, and brown pants, and black shoes. The crouching child is wearing a brown hat, black long-sleeved shirt, orange scarf, green pants, and black boots. In the background are more farm fields, a forest, buildings, and a black water tower.|~|Signed "ברגיטה פרנקפורטר" in lower left.
Description.caption: שי מאת הקרן הקימת לישראל, ירושלים
Title: אדמה אדמתי

Project Name: Zionist Posters Promoting Israel to Diaspora Jews, 1940-1979
Subject: Tourism $z Israel
Description.note: Poster depicts an adolescent boy and adolescent girl carrying giant red grapes on a branch. Both are wearing blue and white clothing and brown sandals. A blue and white pole bears a sign reading "Israel". A grape leaf reads "ישראל". The giant grapes contain images of contemporary buildings, ruins, the Tower of David, orchards, and oases with camels. Background is tan.

Project Name: Zionist Posters Promoting Israel to Diaspora Jews, 1940-1979
Subject: Israel $x History $y 1948-1967 $v Maps|~|Land settlement $z Israel $v Maps
Name.creator: Pikovsky, M.
Description.note: Scale 1:500,000 ; 1:1.000.000.|~|Poster is a map of Eretz Israel, depicting Keren Kayemeth and other Jewish lands, "musha" (land held in joint ownership) with Keren Kayemeth and private individuals, Jewish settlements, Arab localities, settlements established by Keren Hayesod, settlements subsidized by Keren Hayesod, and settlements with individual settlers receiving Keren Hayesod subsidies.|~|Includes inset of Southern Edom.|~|Relief shown by shading.
Description.caption: Printed in Palestine|~|Issued by the Head Offices of the Keren Kayemeth Leisrael, Jerusalem|~|LOOK at the area acquired by the Keren Kayemeth in Eretz Israel and settled by the Keren Hayesod. SEE how small and insignificant the Jewish share has hitherto been in the land and settlement of this country, the land of our hopes, and CONSIDER how great are the tasks that still lie before us! THEN YOU WILL KNOW that every man and woman among our people must do his utmost to further the realisation of the great task of redemption of the land and its upbuilding.|~|Goldberg's Press, Jerusalem|~|Zincography M. Pikovsky
Title: ארץ ישראל = Eretz Israel

Project Name: Zionist Posters Promoting Israel to Diaspora Jews, 1940-1979
Subject: Poultry farms $z Israel
Name.creator: Berger, Zvi
Description.note: A boy with brown curly hair stands on a ladder leading up to a dovecot. He is getting ready to feed them. He is wearing a green kova tembel hat, blue shirt, and black short pants. In the background, another boy wearing a blue shirt, white hat, and grey shorts, and carrying a bucket is walking through a gate towards the first boy. Several more doves are on the ground eating, while one flies through the air. Trees and houses are in the background. Poster is primarily in blue, green, yellow, and orange.|~|Artist signature: צ. ברגר

Project Name: Zionist Posters Promoting Israel to Diaspora Jews, 1940-1979
Publisher.publisherName: Jewish National Fund. $b Youth and Education Department
Subject: Reclamation of land $z Israel
Name.creator: Tamir, Zvi
Name.subject: Jewish National Fund
Description.note: Poster depicts a stylized palm branch with illustrations of the Jewish National Fund's efforts in each leaf; background is blue with a white border. The following illustrations are in the leaves: a claw on a crane in a marsh; a hilly forest; a man pushing dirt with a bulldozer, with tree-covered hills in the background; a man wearing a kova tembel and drilling into a mountain road with a jackhammer while a bulldozer moves dirt on the road in the horizon; a family carrying luggage and walking from a boat to a settlement with buildings, trees, and a water tower in the horizon.
Description.caption: Zvi Tamir 62|~|Jewish National Fund- Youth and Education Dept. 42 East 69th Street, New York 21, N.Y.|~|JNF drains swamps, JNF plants forests, JNF prepares the soil, JNF builds roads through mountains and deserts, JNF gives land and employment to new immigrants
Title: What does the Jewish National Fund do in Israel?

Project Name: Zionist Posters Promoting Israel to Diaspora Jews, 1940-1979

Title: הערצל

Project Name: Zionist Posters Promoting Israel to Diaspora Jews, 1940-1979
Subject: Poultry farms $z Israel
Name.creator: Keller, P.
Description.note: A dark-haired boy in a red kova tembel hat, blue shirt, and red-brown shorts stands by a pond carrying a basket of greens. A blonde girl in a red and white striped shirt and red shorts kneels by the pond, throwing bread crumbs into the pond. In and around the pond are ducks, swans, turkeys, and a frog on a lily pad. A red-roofed coop is in the background.
Description.caption: Issued by the Jewish National Fund, Jerusalem. Publie par le Keren Kayemeth LeIsrael, Jerusalem. Publicacion del Keren Kayemeth LeIsrael, Jerusalen. הוצאת הקרך הקימת לישראל, ירושלים.
Title: עופות = Poultry = Volaille = Aves

Project Name: Zionist Posters Promoting Israel to Diaspora Jews, 1940-1979
Subject: Families $z Israel|~|Israel $x Social life and customs|~|Outdoor recreation $z Israel
Name.creator: Barak, Nachsholi, $d 1922-
Description.note: A family of seven dressed in shades of blue and white sits at a wooden and stone picnic table out in a forest. Two of them wear blue kova tembel hats. Behind them is another family, a green tent, and a campfire with a pot over the fire. Next to the table are a couple of green backpacks.|~|Artist's signature: ב. נחשולי
Description.caption: Issued by the Jewish National Fund, Jerusalem. Publie par le Keren Kayemeth LeIsrael, Jerusalem. Publicacion del Keren Kayemeth LeIsrael, Jerusalen. הוצאת הקרך הקימת לישראל, ירושלים.

Project Name: Zionist Posters Promoting Israel to Diaspora Jews, 1940-1979
Subject: Land settlement $z Israel|~|Agriculture $z Israel|~|Farm life $z Israel|~|Wheat farmers $z Israel
Name.creator: Berger, Zvi
Description.note: Artist signature: צ. ברגר|~|A man uses a scythe to reap wheat while a boy carries the harvested wheat in bundles. Both are smiling. The man wears a straw hat, white tank top, and blue pants. The boy wears a blue hat, blue shirt, and green pants. Behind them a man wearing a blue kova tembel hat and green outfit drives a red combine harvester and another man wearing a green kova tembel hat and blue shirt drives a red tractor cart next to him to collect the harvested wheat. A number of white and red buildings are in the background with a water tower. The sun is up, and birds are flying over the wheat fields. Poster is primarily red, blue, and yellow.
Description.caption: Issued by the Jewish National Fund, Jerusalem. Publie par le Keren Kayemeth LeIsrael, Jerusalem. Publicacion del Keren Kayemeth LeIsrael, Jerusalen. הוצאת הקרך הקימת לישראל, ירושלים.
Title: קציר = The wheat harvest = La moisson du ble = La cosecha

Project Name: Zionist Posters Promoting Israel to Diaspora Jews, 1940-1979
Subject: Land settlement $z Israel|~|Agriculture $z Israel|~|Farm life $z Israel|~|Families $z Israel
Name.creator: Berger, Zvi
Description.note: A farmer family home. In the foreground is a yellow and red house with its doors open, allowing a view inside. A woman in a teal dress and white apron stands at the front gate, sweeping the front path. A dog sits outside its green doghouse. A man in a yellow hat waters a tree. A boy sits at a patio table reading. In the background are a barn with a cow and donkey, a silo with a tractor next to it, and a chicken coop. Behind the house, a woman in a red dress and white apron is walking towards the house from the barn, carrying two buckets. Poster is primarily red, yellow, light green, and teal.|~|Artist signature: צ. ברגר
Description.caption: Issued by the Jewish National Fund, Jerusalem. Publie par le Keren Kayemeth LeIsrael, Jerusalem. Publicacion del Keren Kayemeth LeIsrael, Jerusalen. הוצאת הקרך הקימת לישראל, ירושלים.
Title: בית האיכר = The farmer's house = La ferme = La casa del campesino

Name.subject: Shazar, Zalman, $d 1889-1974
Description.note: A print of a painted portrait of Zalman Shazar, president of Israel. It is of his upper body. He sits with a bookcase behind him. He is balding and wears glasses, a suit, and tie. Painting is based on a photograph of Shazar. Portrait is in shades of brown.|~|Poster title is the subject's signature.|~|Artist's signature: צ. ברגר
Description.caption: Keren Kayemet LeIsrael (JNF), Jerusalem / Zalman Shazar. קרן קומת לישראל, ירושלים, זלמן שזר.|~|Issued by the Youth & Education Department, The Jewish National Fund, New York. הוצאת הקרן הקומת לישראל, המחלקה לחינוך ולנוער, ניו יורק.

Project Name: Zionist Posters Promoting Israel to Diaspora Jews, 1940-1979
Subject: Land settlement $z Israel|~|Villages ǂz Israel
Description.note: Poster depicts a village scene with the following labeled buildings and structures: an Egged bus station, a post office, a grocery store, a Tnuva food processing co-op, a clinic, a school, a kindergarten, a village committee, a granary, a bakery, a cultural center, and a synagogue. In the background are fields, trees, white buildings with red roofs, and a hill with a water tower.

Name.creator: Goren, Peninah
Description.note: Artist's signature: פנינה גורן|~|Five children and a man with a banana cart. Three boys are holding banana bunches, bringing them to the cart. Two boys wear blue kova tembel hats, one wears a yellow straw hat. One girl with pigtails, wearing a yellow straw hat, sits on the cart, eating a banana. Another girl with a purple, flowered headscarf has a smaller cart, bringing a banana bunch to the cart. The man is the cart driver, holding the reins to his brown donkey, waiting for the children to load the bananas. He wears a green kova tembel hat. Poster is primarily green, blue, and yellow.
Description.caption: Issued by the Jewish National Fund, Jerusalem. Publie par le Keren Kayemeth LeIsrael, Jerusalem. Publicacion del Keren Kayemet LeIsrael, Jerusalen. הוצאת הקרך הקימת לישראל, ירושלים.
